title: The beginning of Season 6 is going to be a balance nightmare
body:
ADCs, who have been strong (as the only mandatory class in the game) are getting buffs to base AD, huge buffs to all their items, and nerfs to nearly all their competitors items.

Meanwhile, on the few items that ADCs share with other people, such as {{item:3153}} on fighters, instead of doing what they did to {{item:3930}} and making the item different for ranged/melee, they just straight up nerfed the item.  Its almost as if riot doesn't understand what a huge difference there is between melee champs and ranged one, and even on shorter ranged champs the safety that their inherent range provides.

ADCs that have gone top in the past are going to be going top all the time now, thanks to lifesteal on every item, basic items meant to counter health tanks and armor tanks, and the LW upgrade now has GW, so forget about trying to play {{champion:36}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:266}} .

And with this huge buff to adcs across the board, you know who is going to return with a vengeance?? Assassins.  The game is going to become a rock-paper-scissors match played out at champ select, even more so than it is now.  Because if a team goes tanky, the other team is free to go with an almost all ADC lineup and utterly smash the tanks/fighters.  If a team goes into a multi-ADC lineup, the other team can go assassin heavy and delete them before they get the chance to attack move.  And if a team starts going assassin strong, the other team will go tanky fighters who can duel the assassins.

Riot, pls reevaluate your preseason patch, in regards to much of the marksmen itemization.  Yes, you finally broke up the "these 5 items are the best and I will get them every game, no matter what."  {{item:3031}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3006}} .    But as a whole, the marksmen itemization change puts them too over the top.  They even took items away from other classes who that item was designed for.

{{item:3078}} Revert the changes.  Like wtf, {{champion:81}} does not need this item to only be about him.  Triforce is a bruiser item.
{{item:3156}} Get that passive out of there.  You can add a "lifeline" passive, but MAW was meant for bruisers/fighters who need the MR/shield to keep from getting blown up when they are in the other teams face.  Ranged ADCs dont have that problem.
{{item:3153}} Make it deal less damage for ranged champs (as in the current PBE value.)  Otherwise, the % current health remains the same for melees.
{{item:3035}} On the last whisper + executioners calling upgrade, make the passive GW into an active, with reduced time on the GW (1.5 sec vs 3 sec.)
{{item:3071}} Revert the health changes.  This item is meant for fighters, not ADCs.  It is literally perfect as it is ATM, if you make the PBE changes, you run into the same problems you had before when it was a high AD/low health item.
{{item:3157}} Revert nerfs. You can't introduce all these new items that are going to put AD mid laners over the top AND nerf the AP armor item.  1 step at a time riot.
{{item:3075}} Put on active where when activated attacks receive higher return damage and GW for 1.5 sec.

Also, GW should be reworked (on everything except ignite, which should be renamed to "deadly wound.")  where instead of being a i hit = full apply, GW now stacks up to 4 times, with 10% healing reduc per stack.

Just my 2 cents on the upcoming PBE patch for Season 6.  Riot is taking a huge step forward in finally addressing the state of AD items, but as usual they are overbuffing the hell out of one class all at once, while simultaneously nerfing most of their counters.  Hopefully we will get some more response from Riot before the patch goes live in a couple of weeks before we have another "league of black cleavers" "league of assassins" type deal with ADCs in every lane and kindred banned because they can jungle

Playing devil's advocate here for a moment.

Do you realize how annoying it is to fight the a fore-mentioned champions in lane? No matter what you do, no matter what tactic you pull, no matter how much harass you land on them, they will constantly ignore you, and just regenerate all of their health, often at no cost to themselves. How would you feel if you had to constantly work to just KEEP the health of one those champs low, and to slack off for A SINGLE MOMENT, and their health is back to full in no time flat.

In fights/engages, you outplay the enemy champ, like Volibear or Mundo, get them low, and they just activate massive health regen to invalidate all of the effort you had just spent out-fighting them. You probably have nothing left at that point, and they are more than ready for a second round.

In bronze this is true.  However in gold+ (maybe some rare smurfing silvers)  mundo and volley are the only two can can maintain their sustain. 

You also used Voli and Mundo, as an example too for the rest. Which they all fall off much faster into other strengths with Voli and Mundo being the only ones who can face tank sustain. You've doused your opinion in bias and it's no longer a fair assessment of the listed champions. 

If you are bias and hate all sustain champions, commenting on "fair/balance" is not your forte because it holds no weight to it's word.

Op is correct in everything he has stated so far, those champions are negatively impacted by all the free sustain (which they sacrificed kit power for) along with GW being easily accessible making champions with sustain in their kit more punished than someone who builds life steal.
I agree with this. And as a Soraka main, I would like to add that you shut down Soraka easily by focusing her. **VERY. HARD.**

This.

She's not a support; she's a second carry that works by preventing you from killing her team instead of killing yours. She has no engage, weak conditional CC, no damage, no mobility, and garbage base stats. The flipside is that as long as you let her do her thing, she is going to make everything short of a full-on diving engage a loss for you.

You win against Soraka by blowing her up before she's had the chance to do anything. You lose against Soraka by skirmishing and poking. That bruiser you traded down to half health with? Yeah, that was a terrible call, because it cost Soraka 20% of her life to knock off 50% of yours.

Yes, that's the way to deal with a Soraka, focus her and kill her to stop the heals. At the same time, how do you reach her? You know, seeing as how her spells are all utility, don't do enough damage to kill anything but minions, and have enough range where she never has to leave the back line. So the only way I see to catch her is to send one teammate to flank and get her by surprise, because fighting her team head-on is only gonna cause her to run backward or behind an ally to safety, spam heal whoever the enemy is focusing, and ult when everyone else starts to get remotely low. Why do you not see many soraka's in low elo? because they position badly or the team doesn't protect her, she dies, and the team dies. Higher up? Peel anyone who tries to get close and it's a free win out of pure attrition. Look my post in the eyes and tell me that's balanced.

The beginning of every season is a balancing nightmare.

>ADCs, who have been strong (as the only mandatory class in the game) are getting buffs to base AD, huge buffs to all their items, and nerfs to nearly all their competitors items.

They're also losing AD per lvl and a lot of AD on standard ADC items.  In total, ADC's are losing a good bit of AD.  Combine this with the increased gold accumulation in game and you've got a significantly different picture.

Please read ALL changes on PBE, not just those that you want to see.

There are points which I agree on with OP, but you stated the single most important fact regarding these changes: there are more changes than just the superficial ones. Imho people are reacting inappropriately to the _tentative_ balance, as if it was about to be pushed to live...
Except that more than 90% of the time, if it's on PBE, it's in the next patch...

Maybe, I wouldn't be surprised if they hold on to tweak and tune things a bit more before it goes live.  

Even then, jungle items are getting some needed love, gold generation is up, AD is down, Bork passive is nerfed, % pen is nerfed.  

About the only aspects I'm concerned about are that the gold generation is enough to keep up with the price increases on items and hoping they give mages a little more mana regen on items.  The mana buffs are a good start imo, but I think some regen would go a long way.  We'll see, still experimenting.

While I agree with you about the concern over removal of mana potions, I'm almost more concerned about ADC's now having access to GW.  They're obviously trying to make Garen and Darius less viable, but are ignoring the fact that this means that prety much every sustain focused tank except Mundo is going to completely disappear at top level play, and they're already pretty rare other than Aatrox.
Honestly, I'm not worried about pro play.

Lack of AD doesn't mean much when you have much more critical chance at your disposal along with new toys to work with (easy 40% cdr and %DR along with more upfront burst in statikk/rapidfire and easier access to lifesteal). Yeah I might have less total AD as Lucian but it doesn't really matter when my crit chance averages at 70+ and have 30-40% cdr and 17% LS on critical and 28% physical vamp on champions without building a single life steal item and potentially also have 12% DR. Less AD does mean less front loaded damage but almost every ADC becomes a sustained damage dealing drain tank monster late game that is incredibly hard to kill (Ez and Lucian have extremely short cd gap closers with CDR where Lucian especially can repeatedly use it if he staggers autos correctly since at max CDR E+AA+Q+AA makes Es cd basically 0 since it drops it from 8.4 to 0.4).

I think ADCs are too strong against tanks now but in general I feel like most ADCs need the buffs. 

The top ADCs are only top ADCs because they have loads of self peel and mobility, if not then they're Ashe or Sivir who have the utility to stay relevant even when they're behind. ADCs can go 50-0 but they're still able to be even one-shot by some assassins and more fighters can outduel them like Yi unless they have that self peel/mobility. The ADC role currently feels terrible to play, do well with little pay off. You NEED your team and you can't just walk up and try to duel people. If your team can't protect you always your success is nearly worthless. 

There is a reason why ADC is the only role to be babysitted for the first 5 - 15 minutes because if not then most teams could simply just level 1 dive them for free kills.

I think it is going to be interesting to see how balance ends up. The zhonyas nerf is to nerf assassins which you mention may end up too strong. However, picking multiple marksmen/squishies doesn't mean an auto win for assassins. With some new buffs for bodyguards (such as 8%reduction and siphon from dmg to  Adc) plus save mechanics like tahm assassins will likely struggle if they aren't good enough to choose hood timing.
The Zhonya's nerf actually indirectly buffs AD assassins like Zed and Talon.

Yes and no. It nerfs AP assassins so AD assassins are a stronger choice by comparison, bu I'd argue there are other changes that indirectly nerf  AD assassins in ways that don't make it a buff overall (even if it's easier to kill mages and AP assassins w/out them having access to zhonya's as soon). Tank supports get a buff having the new mastery trees allowing them to get both utility and defensive masteries without sacrificing access to the other, so more often supports will be harder to one shot. Additionally with ADC's likely being stronger there are two issues that nerf AD assassins as a result. The first is that killing the APC is worth less if the value of another target is higher because you are having to give up more and getting less from killing the target who now lacks zhonyas, so if you have to trade lives to do it, there is less value now. Second, ADC's having more sustain options and EC again to hurt other champ's sustain may let champs like quinn or graves top be stronger picks, and picking an AD assassin w/ two AD champs already let's the enemy stack armor which is a huge nerf to AD assassins. It may not turn out that way but it's hard to predict shifts.
